strings: <se_low>Yangus: Maybe it weren't such a cock up lettin' the Lord o' Darkness come back to life, y'know...
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, it's better that we just fight 'im now an' get it over wiv. Then people won't 'ave to keep dreadin' the day 'e wakes up, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: It's pretty depressin' goin' back to the same place where ya lost a fight before, ain't it?

<se_def>Angelo: Don't say things like that!
You'll jinx us.
Negative thoughts bring negative outcomes.

<se_low>Yangus: I, I weren't 'avin' no negative thoughts!
I was just<endash>
<se_high>Jessica: For once, I agree with Angelo!

<se_high>Jessica: We may have lost before, but now we understand his attack pattern.
That's progress.

<se_low>Yangus: Ya got me all wrong!
I weren't sayin' nuffin' negative!
<se_low>Yangus: We lost before cos somefin' was botherin' me in the back o' me mind. I didn't want our journey together to come to an end, see, guv.

<se_low>Yangus: But I've got all that out me system now!
I ain't gonna 'old back this time!

<se_low>Yangus: I thought we'd seen the last o' this lot when we defeated the Lord o' Darkness!
He was s'posed to be the boss, weren't 'e?

<se_low>Yangus: We'll be in trouble if we 'ave to fight many more o' these monsters.
Now'd be a good time to fly!

<se_high>Jessica: We've got the Lord of Darkness right where we want him.
I can feel it.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't care how many times we lost before.
We'll take him down this time, for sure!
<se_high>Jessica: I know time is of the essence, but we still need to do everything we can to prepare ourselves for the big battle.
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't, we might not live to regret it!
<se_high>Jessica: This place isn't going to be around much longer!
<se_high>Jessica: Let's use the soulstone and get out of here!
<se_def>Angelo: When that lump of rock emerged from the bowels of Neos, I wondered what on earth it could be.<page>Angelo: I never imagined anything like this citadel!
<se_def>Angelo: I have to tell you, as a boy I certainly didn't expect I'd be doing this kind of thing when I grew up. Maybe I am cursed.

<se_high>Jessica: Is that defeat I hear in your voice?
That isn't like you, Angelo.

<se_def>Angelo: It's not that. It's just, when I look back over my life, it's obvious I haven't exactly had the best run of luck.<page>Angelo: And given our current situation, I don't see that changing.
Do you?

<se_low>Yangus: No need to get so mis'rable, mate.
We've gotta make our own luck.

<se_def>Angelo: Dear Goddess! I'M being preached at by YANGUS!
...Anyway, I wasn't being miserable!
<se_def>Angelo: Dhoulmagus, Jessica, Leopold...and now him...
<se_def>Angelo: Fair enough that the Lord of Darkness doesn't seem to set much store by rank or title, but doesn't he have any taste?

<se_def>Angelo: If I were seeking vessels for my soul, I'd have a firm rule to stick to beautiful women.
Anything else would be a waste.
<se_def>Angelo: This place is getting more familiar, that's for sure. But that doesn't help it feel any more cosy.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's make this the last time we visit.
<se_def>Angelo: It looks like this is about as far as we can come on foot.

<se_def>Angelo: We're nearly out of options...
But at times like these, the only way is up.
<se_low>Yangus: It feels like there was still people livin' 'ere 'til just recently, don't it?

<se_low>Yangus: But there's not a soul around now.
It's weird.
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta save our energy and get to where Rhapthorne is as quick as possible.

<se_low>Yangus: Just go for it!
Aim at 'is chair an' run like 'ell!

<se_low>Yangus: I thought we'd seen the last o' this lot when we defeated the Lord o' Darkness!
He was s'posed to be the boss, weren't 'e?

<se_low>Yangus: We'll be in trouble if we 'ave to fight many more o' these monsters.
Now'd be a good time to fly!
<se_high>Jessica: The layout of this building is so unbelievably complicated.

<se_high>Jessica: Rhapthorne has to be here somewhere.
But where?

<se_high>Jessica: We've been through here before.
Are we lost again?

<se_high>Jessica: Not that I'm blaming you.
I don't have much of a sense of direction, either.
<se_high>Jessica: This place isn't going to be around much longer!
<se_high>Jessica: Let's use the soulstone and get out of here!
<se_def>Angelo: So this is where the great Lord of Darkness lives? Let's hope we finally get to meet our esteemed host.
<se_def>Angelo: I haven't felt so excited for a long time.
<se_def>Angelo: Better avoid unnecessary encounters and save our energy for the battle with Rhapthorne.
<se_def>Angelo: The fight, my <IF_SOLO>friend<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>friends<ENDIF_SOLO>, starts now.
<se_def>Angelo: It looks like this is about as far as we can come on foot.

<se_def>Angelo: We're nearly out of options...
But at times like these, the only way is up.
<se_low>Yangus: The Lord o' Darkness is in 'ere somewhere.
<se_low>Yangus: No matter 'ow many times I go there, I don't think I'll ever be able to find me way 'round that weird circular street below 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Better let someone else lead the way, eh!
<se_low>Yangus: This is the first time I've ever wished I was carryin' a bit less excess baggage!
<se_low>Yangus: If we get out of 'ere, I'm goin' on a diet!
<se_high>Jessica: What is this place...?

<se_def>Angelo: I'd say the master of the house is beyond here.
I can feel the evil aura creeping up through the soles of my boots.

<se_def>Angelo: Let's get a move on.
I've been waiting to meet our friend Rhapthorne for long enough already.

<se_high>Jessica: It won't be long now.
I'm finally about to face my brother's enemy...

<se_high>Jessica: Rhapthorne is in there.
Now there's nothing stopping us.
Let's go!

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to get out of here!
Once we're out in the open, we can use the soulstone and fly!

<se_high>Jessica: Run! RUN!
No time to talk now!
<se_def>Angelo: I don't know if it's some effect of our proximity to the Lord of Darkness, but I keep being pestered by childhood memories.

<se_def>Angelo: All those things should be dead and buried now.
Now of all times. They're meaningless.
<se_def>Angelo: I don't know if it's some effect of our proximity to the Lord of Darkness, but I keep being pestered by childhood memories.

<se_def>Angelo: All those things should be dead and buried now.
Now of all times. They're meaningless.
<se_def>Angelo: Come on! If the path beneath our feet collapses in the quakes, we'll have no hope of escape. We need to move fast!
<se_low>Yangus: It's just another normal street.
<se_low>Yangus: Rhapthorne should be gettin' closer, but I ain't gettin' no sense of evil or nuffin'.
<se_def>Angelo: ...Sadly, I don't think he's here.

<se_def>Angelo: But I can feel a slight tingling. We've got to stay sharp or we might miss something vital.
Examine everything closely.

<se_def>Angelo: And not just with your eyes.
We'll have to use all our senses, all our perception, to get through this place.

<se_low>Yangus: Looks like a straight road.
Nuffin' strange about this place.
<se_low>Yangus: It don't look like I'd be able to get to where Rhapthorne is on me own from here.

<se_low>Yangus: It's...gonna go!
We...gotta get movin'!

<se_high>Jessica: Which way should we take...?
Don't ask me! I always get lost.

<se_high>Jessica: We were a little mixed up there at first, but we're fine now!
Piece of cake!
<se_high>Jessica: Rhapthorne's silly little tricks are getting old.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't die now!
We just defeated Rhapthorne!
We have to get out of here alive!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's get out of here while we're still in one piece!
<se_def>Angelo: Want to know the worst thing you can do when you've lost your way?

<se_def>Angelo: What you're doing right now.
Too much thinking, and not enough action!
Get moving!

<se_def>Angelo: There's no point puzzling over which way to go.
As long as there's a path in front of you, take it!

<se_def>Angelo: Oh!?
Well, if you change your mind, I'll tell you later.

<se_def>Angelo: Whatever we decide, Rhapthorne can't be far away now. So what's it to be?
If you want to go back, this is the last chance.

<se_def>Angelo: Victory is all that matters in this battle.
If you're not sure we can win, there's nothing wrong with turning back.
<se_def>Angelo: And equally, if you're playing to win, there's nothing wrong with a bit of cheating and trickery. ...In my opinion.

<se_def>Angelo: Is this REALLY a good time for a chat!?
Run!
This isn't a joke!

<se_low>Yangus: I can feel 'im gettin' closer.
The big bad boss is nearby.

<se_low>Yangus: An' I'm ready for 'im.
Wotever 'e looks like, we'll show 'im!
<se_low>Yangus: We gotta get ourselves ready before we fight the Lord o' Darkness.
<se_low>Yangus: There ain't much in it between us an' that tub o' lard now, so if we get ev'ryfin' set, we'll 'ammer 'im into the ground!

<se_low>Yangus: It's...gonna go!
We...gotta get movin'!
<se_high>Jessica: What is this place...?

<se_def>Angelo: It looks like there's some sort of strange distortion of space here.
One of Rhapthorne's little tricks, no doubt.

<se_low>Yangus: That's it!
I've 'ad about as much as I can take now!
I want me mum!

<se_low>Yangus: I'm shuttin' me eyes.
Someone'll 'ave to 'old me 'and an' show me the way.

<se_high>Jessica: What's going on here!?
This looks totally different from last time!

<se_high>Jessica: You know, Rhapthorne's getting boring.
It's always the same. He hits us with some hocus-pocus and then turns tail!

<se_high>Jessica: Enough is enough.
He can't fool us any more.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't die now!
We just defeated Rhapthorne!
We have to get out of here alive!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's get out of here while we're still in one piece!
<se_def>Angelo: I like to think that not a lot can rattle me.

<se_def>Angelo: But this...
This is making me pretty nervous.
I don't like it.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's go!

<se_def>Angelo: Is this REALLY a good time for a chat!?
Run!
This isn't a joke!

<se_low>Yangus: Who's the best!? Who's the best!?
Who's the best!? WE ARE!
We're gonna beat 'im!

<se_low>Yangus: Who's the best!? Who's the best!?
Who's the best!? WE ARE!
...Well, we will be this time, any'ow!

<se_low>Yangus: It's...gonna go!
We...gotta get movin'!
<se_low>Yangus: We done it...
<se_high>Jessica: Words can't even describe how happy I am right now...

<se_def>Angelo: Right!
Time to bid this place farewell!
<se_low>Yangus: I-I-I've...lost all me strength...

<se_high>Jessica: I don't know if this is the right time to say it, but thanks.
Thanks for everything, <hero>.

<se_high>Jessica: I never would've made it this far without you.
I mean that.
Thank you, thank you, thank you!
<se_low>Yangus: Cor! Wot's wiv you, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: An' anyway, you'll 'ave to get in line if ya wanna thank the guv.
I owe 'im more than you do.

<se_def>Angelo: Listen to you two! The battle isn't won yet.
If you get too complacent, old Rhappy will be most upset.
<se_def>Angelo: Personally, I'd just like to finish off the troublesome freak, and get the hell out of here.

<se_def>Angelo: So let's save the chat, shall we?
And get on with the job!

<se_high>Jessica: Why, thanks, Angelo!
I hate to break this to you, but we ARE on the job!
<se_high>Jessica: When we first started out, all I could think about was getting revenge for Alistair's murder.

<se_high>Jessica: But this isn't about me any more.
We have to win.<page>Jessica: Not just for Alistair, but for all of Rhapthorne's victims. And for every living thing in the World of Light.
<se_high>Jessica: When we first started out, all I could think about was getting revenge for Alistair's murder.

<se_high>Jessica: But this isn't about me any more.
We have to win this time.<page>Jessica: Not just for Alistair, but for all of Rhapthorne's victims. And for every living thing in the World of Light.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't die now!
We just defeated Rhapthorne!
We have to get out of here alive!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's get out of here while we're still in one piece!
<se_high>Jessica: Oh, Alistair...

<se_def>Angelo: I think we could save the tête-à-tête for later.
This isn't exactly the best time.
<se_def>Angelo: If at first you don't succeed, learn from your mistakes and try again! Right?

<se_def>Angelo: Is this REALLY a good time for a chat!?
Run!
This isn't a joke!

<se_def>Angelo: There's no need for an extended stay in a place like this.
Time to make our exit.
<se_high>Red: The Lord o' Darkness 'as given us a run for our money, eh? But 'ere we are at last...
<se_high>Red: Right, I've 'ad enough of 'ide-an'-seek to last me a lifetime. Let's get this game over wiv!
<se_high>Red: Blimey, that 'urt. This geezer ain't just got a fancy title, eh?
<se_high>Red: But we ain't come all this way and done all wot we done just to give up at the first 'urdle, 'ave we?
<se_high>Red: Oh, flamin' Nora, wot now? This ain't the time for faffin'! We've gotta get out of 'ere!
<se_low>Morrie: Hm, maybe he is tasting bad, but the Lord of the Darkness lives in a magnifico castello, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, Moro Mozzarella is not gonna be undone! We will take out the Rhapthorne licking the spit, and I get back to my pit to plan my own tasty castello!
<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, it is hard to catch your breathing, ay? Because we climb so high in the sky? Or because this place is full of the bad feelings, maybe?
<se_low>Morrie: Anyways, I can never live in a place like this. No, my pit is the place where I feel myself most at home.
<se_low>Morrie: We must take to the skies! The earth quaking is no matter if we are not touching the ground, ay?

<se_high>Red: Blimey, this place is like a flamin' rabbit warren, eh? Old Rhapthorne ain't just knocked this up since 'e was resurrected, I'd put money
on that.
<se_high>Red: Nah, the 'ole place must've been sealed up wiv 'im, I reckon, an' 'e's been turnin' it into a maze all that time. Either that, or we've really been dossin' about too long!
<se_high>Red: This is 'ardly the time to be goin' off explorin' all over the shop, is it? We don't wanna show up to face Rhapthorne cream-crackered from the start, do we?
<se_high>Red: Oh, flamin' Nora, wot now? This ain't the time for faffin'! We've gotta get out of 'ere!
<se_low>Morrie: Curse the Rhapthorne. This castello is so complicato, we will lose our ways!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah-ha! Maybe this is his strategia, ay? Hmph! What a coward in custard!
<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, it is no matter how many times we are coming here, I can never find my ways. The truth is, I have no sense of direzione.
<se_low>Morrie: We must take to the skies! The earth quaking is no matter if we are not touching the ground, ay?
<se_high>Red: Oh yeah, I'm gettin' a whiff o' somefin' nasty now, that's for sure. The further inta this place we go, the more it reeks! Rhapthorne's this way all right, you mark my words.
<se_high>Red: The more time I 'ave to spend in this place, the more it winds me up! Come on, let's down the fat lump and make this the last time we 'ave to come 'ere.
<se_high>Red: Ya think this is good time for a chat, do ya? Well 'ave fun talkin' to yerself, <hero>, cos some of us are too busy leggin' it to listen!
<se_low>Morrie: The more inside we are going, the more my legs are heavying. And the thicker the air is becoming, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: The first time we came this way, I was feeling afraid. But Moro Mozzarella is not scared of the cat!
<se_low>Morrie: Come, monsters! Come make the fight with me! My PASSION will turn your black souls and make you see the light!

<se_low>Morrie: Do not stop, ragazzo!
I am not left behind you!
Si, I am right behind you!
<se_high>Red: Follow me! I've got a sixth sense when it comes to findin' me way! It'll be left up ahead 'ere. ...Hang on, no, maybe it's right. ...Eh?
<se_high>Red: Argh, this place is doin' me 'ead in!
<se_high>Red: I ain't a block'ead like Yangus. I don't forget me way, ever. Once I've been down a path, that's it. It's carved in me mind.

<se_high>Red: So I don't wanna 'ear no more excuses!
Let's get the job done, awright?
<se_high>Red: Oh, flamin' Nora, 'e's gonna try to take us down wiv 'im, is 'e?
<se_high>Red: Come on then! We've gotta leg it out of 'ere!

<se_low>Morrie: Where is this long road going?
I feel like we are walking around in the circles.

<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, sometimes I make my head think too much, ay?
Va bene! We carry on and we see what is in the stores!
<se_low>Morrie: Allora! We have been right not to turn around, ay? The only way is up? Si?

<se_low>Morrie: Allora! Time to skedoodle, ay?
Last one back home is a loser!
<se_high>Red: Follow me! I've got a sixth sense when it comes to findin' me way! It'll be left up ahead 'ere. ...Hang on, no, maybe it's right. ...Eh?
<se_high>Red: Argh, this place is doin' me 'ead in!
<se_high>Red: The more time I 'ave to spend in this place, the more it winds me up! Come on, let's down the fat lump and make this the last time we 'ave to come 'ere.
<se_high>Red: Oh, flamin' Nora, 'e's gonna try to take us down wiv 'im, is 'e?
<se_high>Red: Come on then! We've gotta leg it out of 'ere!

<se_low>Morrie: Where is this long road going?
I feel like we are walking around in the circles.

<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, sometimes I make my head think too much, ay?
Va bene! We carry on and we see what is in the stores!
<se_low>Morrie: I can do it! Moro can do it! Moro can do ANYTHING! ...I must hippotise myself to bring out all of my GUSTO and make myself as potent as possibile!

<se_low>Morrie: Allora! Time to skedoodle, ay?
Last one back home is a loser!

<se_high>Red: I s'pose it's your influence, eh, <hero>?
Yangus is a lot tougher now than wot 'e used to be, that's for sure.

<se_high>Red: Back when 'e was a kid, 'e was such a useless
lump, ya wouldn't believe it. I mean, 'e's still
a lump now, but 'e does 'ave 'is uses, I'll give
'im that.
<se_high>Red: So...ta for ev'ryfin' you've done for 'im.
<se_low>Yangus: Oi, wot are you two whisperin' about, eh? Guv?

<se_high>Red: Eh? Nuffin'!
Mind yer own, you!

<se_high>Red: Not a word to Yangus about wot I just said, right? Ya got that, <hero>?
Not a flamin' word!

<se_high>Red: It's funny, ain't it? After you've stared Death
in the face once, you ain't scared no more.
In fact, I could smash 'is flamin' teeth in!
<se_high>Red: I ain't gonna let that fatso get the better of us again, you mark my words!
<se_high>Red: Oh, flamin' Nora, 'e's gonna try to take us down wiv 'im, is 'e?
<se_high>Red: Come on then! We've gotta leg it out of 'ere!
<se_high>Red: We done it...

<se_high>Red: Gordon Bennett, we really done it... Heh heh.
I must be losin' me touch gettin' this worn out by a little workout like that.
<se_high>Red: I'll be honest, the idea of goin' into battle against someone called the Lord o' Darkness ain't exactly my idea o' fun. I'm a little bit scared, an' I don't mind admittin' it.
<se_high>Red: But no bandit worth 'er salt would turn tail now, right? I got more pride than that, don't you worry!

<se_low>Morrie: I was never thinking I would come to save the world with my PASSION. Si, I have the very big PASSION, I know this. The biggest, infatti!
But this is a great honour.
<se_low>Morrie: I am proud to say I am fighting by your side, ragazzo. I do not know how I thank you enough for this opportunità.

<se_low>Morrie: But it is not over until the fat lady sinks, ay?
Or the fat don! Allora! We finish this now.
Time to take out the tash!
<se_low>Morrie: Si, the Rhapthorne is formidabile. If the fat don would be open to my suggesting, I ask him to come in my pit and join my monster team.

<se_low>Morrie: But it is just a pope dream, ay?
Va bene! We destroy the Lord of the Darkness and hope he is reborn in another world as the friend of the humans, si?

<se_low>Morrie: Allora! Time to skedoodle, ay?
Last one back home is a loser!

<se_low>Morrie: Mamma mia!
For this battle, I have used all my GUSTO.
Si...I am poop.
